DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetics Karyotype Related Subclone Identifier Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a text field to provide a gene sequence/formula (by International System for Human Cytogenetic Nomenclature guidelines) for a section of chromosome material to be duplicated to study its function.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the formula (according to ISCN guidelines) to describe the gene sequence for chromosomal material of interest for duplication to study its functionality and/or structural abnormalities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cytogenetics is the study of chromosomes and the related disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.:Karyotype; the appearance of the chromosomal makeup of a somatic cell in an individual or species, including the number and arrangement and size and structure of the chromosomes.

Concepts.definition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.
The chromosomal morphology and number in somatic cells of an individual.

Property.preferredDefinition: Related; connected or associated.:A DNA clone generated by transferring a cloned DNA fragment from one plasmid to another.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A DNA clone generated by transferring a cloned DNA fragment from one plasmid to another.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a text field to describe the complete cell karyotype including chromosomal breakpoints and cells per clone according to current International System for Human Cytogenetic Nomenclature guidelines.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description:
For complete description of karyotype syntax see: Shaffer, L. G. and Tommerup, N. (eds): ISCN 2005: An International System for Human Cytogenetic Numenclature.  S. Karger, Basel, 2005. ISBN: 3-8055-8019-3
(previous ed) Mitelman, F. (ed): ISCN 1995: An International System for Human Cytogenetic Numenclature.  S. Karger, Basel, 1995. ISBN 3-8055-6226-8

ReferenceDocuments.description:
For complete description of karyotype syntax see: Shaffer, L. G. and Tommerup, N. (eds): ISCN 2005: An International System for Human Cytogenetic Numenclature.  S. Karger, Basel, 2005. ISBN: 3-8055-8019-3
